Bioethanol.Description: Corn is one of the main feedstocks used for the production of bioethanol.
Sugar cane is a widely used feedstock for bioethanol production, especially in tropical regions.
Cellulosic biomass, such as agricultural residues and dedicated energy crops, can be used as feedstock for bioethanol production.

Bioethanol.Relation: is used in the fermentation process by
Bioethanol.Description: Microorganisms, such as yeast or bacteria, are used in the fermentation process to convert sugars into bioethanol.
